name: microdose
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an extremely small dose (= measured amount) of a medicine or drug: In homoeopathy, illnesses are treated using highly diluted forms of herbs and minerals, known as microdoses, that in higher quantities could give rise to the same problems as those that are being treated.
a very small dose (= measured amount) of a psychedelic drug (= one that affects the mind) taken in an attempt to become better at solving problems or at thinking of new ideas, or to treat medical problems such as anxiety, depression, or headaches: A microdose is generally considered to be one-20th to one-tenth of a recreational dose.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are two basic processes employed in order to obtain the microdoses: dilution and dynamisation.About an hour or two after ingesting the microdose, people notice an increase in focus and energy.
